channel.title: Java Compiler (Not a noob, just forgot) :x
channel.description:
Yeah, So been away from programming for a few months and forgot how to make a compiler.
http://puu.sh/75VHm.jpg
What is wrong with my code, that it's giving me that error. Basically I want the java files in src to compile into class files in bin. Thanks.
And yes, there is a java file inside src.

item.title: Java Compiler (Not a noob, just forgot) :x
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Yeah, mdog invented some incredible technology. The entire compiler was only a few KB in size.

On a serious note, you obviously are a noob if you can’t figure out how to use the most integral piece of tooling in the java SDK.
Open your command prompt, run the command javac and read the command line documentation.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Compiler (Not a noob, just forgot) :x
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

-cp should point to bin not src, as this specifies where the .class files can be found. I reckon this is overriding the -sourcepath flag and making it check the wrong directory. Infact, I’m pretty sure you don’t even need to use -cp until you actually run the program but it probably wont do any harm.

Read more here: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/javac.html

Read full topic
